abstracts.cdata!:
This is the Implementation Completion
            Report (ICR) for the Agricultural Services Project (PASA) in
            Guinea-Bissau. The original main project objective was to
            build up, over a three-year period, the capacity within the
            Ministry of Rural Development and Fisheries (MDRP) which was
            divided in two separate ministries: Ministry of Rural
            Development and Agriculture(MDRA) and Ministry of Fisheries
            (MP) to: i) manage its human resources with particular
            attention to technical assistance; (ii) plan activities in
            the agricultural sector and coordinate external aid; (iii)
            fulfill its technical role in the different agriculture
            subsectors; and (iv) ensure monitoring of sectoral
            implementation and impact of the Government's
            Structural Adjustment Program (SAP) of 1987 - 1988. The
            overall project outcome is judged unsatisfactory because
            there was a large disproportion between project costs and
            benefits. Bank performance was rated as satisfactory.
            Overall, the performance of the borrower was rated as
            deficient. Key Lessons Learned were as follows:(a)better
            project design and preparation;(b)borrower's
            ownership;(c) better monitoring of the human resources
            capacity building and performance;(d)upfront training in
            important aspects of proiect management and bank
            guidelines;and(e)sharpening the research and extension linkages.

abstracts.cdata!:
The Agricultural Services Project's
            objective is to build up, over a three-year period, a
            capacity in the Ministry of Rural Development and Fisheries
            (MDRP) to (1) manage its human resources,(2) plan activities
            in the agriculture sector and coordinate external aid, (3)
            fulfill its technical role in the different agriculture
            subsectors and (4) ensure monitoring of sectoral
            implementation and impact of the Government's
            Structural Adjustment Program (1987-88). First, the project
            aims to support MDRP's management with a Human
            Resources Division to manage technical assistance and to
            make recommendations on local personnel management policies.
            Second, it also plans to enhance MDRP's capacity in
            sector planning by further strengthening the Planning Bureau
            of MDRP (GAPLA) in (a) collection, analysis and
            interpretation of statistics; (b) strategy and policy
            planning; (c) aid coordination; (d) project planning; and
            (e) monitoring and evaluation.  Third, the project seeks to
            strengthen MDRP's support services through selective
            improvements in its technical departments. Depending on the
            specific priority needs of each Department, the project
            provides physical facilities, technical assistance, training
            and operating funds.  Under the project, a special fund will
            also be established to meet needs, as they arise.
